nodes.name: Spurious visual cue reliance in global stability prediction models
aliases: Visual shortcut bias in stability prediction
Local-cue dependence in block-tower physics models
nodes.description: End-to-end vision models trained to predict whether a block tower will fall often exploit simple local visual cues that correlate with labels in the training set instead of reasoning about centre-of-mass physics, causing systematic failures when the correlation is absent.
nodes.node_rationale: Highlighted in 'Local Stability as a Visual Cue' where error rate jumps on hard scenarios, showing risk of shortcut reliance.

nodes.name: Correlation between local and global stability labels in training data for block towers
aliases: Training data bias linking local and global stability
Positive correlation of local and global stability in easy scenarios
nodes.description: In the easy subset of the ShapeStacks dataset, towers with globally unstable configurations almost always exhibit a local instability at the same interface, creating a strong statistical cue that models can memorise instead of learning physical rules.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed in 'Dataset' and evidenced in Figure 3 where networks trained on the biased split fail on the hard, anti-correlated split.

nodes.name: Gradient-weighted supplemental tasks modulate feature extraction in neural networks
aliases: Supplemental task influence via λ weighting
nodes.description: Adding a loss on a secondary task to hidden activations with positive (auxiliary) or negative (adversarial) weight steers the encoder toward or away from features that are predictive of that task, thereby controlling what information is present.
nodes.node_rationale: Formalised in equations (2)–(4) in section 'Neural Stethoscopes'.

nodes.name: Neural stethoscope framework for promoting or suppressing task-specific information in hidden layers
nodes.description: A probe network attached to any layer provides an independent loss that can (i) analyse representations (λ=0), (ii) encourage complementary information (λ>0) or (iii) suppress nuisance factors (λ<0) without changing the main architecture.
nodes.node_rationale: Motivated in 'Neural Stethoscopes' introduction and Figure 1.

nodes.name: Auxiliary stethoscope training on instability origin features (λ>0)
nodes.description: A two-layer perceptron attached to the penultimate layer predicts which block interface will initiate collapse; its loss is added with positive weight so the encoder learns features relevant to global physics.
nodes.node_rationale: Implemented in 'Promotion of Complementary Information' experiments (Figure 5).

nodes.name: Adversarial stethoscope training on local stability features (λ<0)
nodes.description: A probe trained to classify local block instability is attached to the encoder; its loss is back-propagated with a negative weight so the encoder maximally confuses the probe, removing local-stability information.
nodes.node_rationale: Described in 'Suppression of Nuisance Information' and visualised in Figure 6a.

nodes.name: Analytic stethoscope probing across network layers (λ=0)
nodes.description: Fixed-capacity probes are attached to successive activation tensors without affecting the main weights, measuring the linear separability of supplemental tasks to locate where different information resides.
nodes.node_rationale: Used in 'Task Relationship Analysis' (Figure 4) to map information flow.

nodes.name: Auxiliary stethoscope improves hard-scenario accuracy over baseline
nodes.description: When trained only on hard scenarios, adding an origin-prediction stethoscope with 0.5 ≤ λ ≤ 16 raises global-stability accuracy from chance-level 51 % to well above 65 % and outperforms baseline across all scenarios.
nodes.node_rationale: Reported in Figure 5 showing substantial accuracy gains.

nodes.name: Adversarial stethoscope reduces bias and increases robustness
nodes.description: With λ ≈ −8 the adversarial stethoscope keeps >95 % accuracy on easy cases while lifting hard-scenario accuracy from 8 % to ~60 % and lowering the Pearson correlation between predicted global stability and local-stability ground truth.
nodes.node_rationale: Shown in Figure 6a; demonstrates successful de-biasing.

nodes.name: Layer-wise analytic stethoscope reveals distribution of local and global stability information
nodes.description: Passive probes show local-stability accuracy peaks early (after Inception-7a) while global-stability and instability-origin accuracy continue to increase deeper, indicating that local-stability features are separable earlier than physical reasoning features.
nodes.node_rationale: Data presented in Figure 4 under 'Task Relationship Analysis'.

nodes.name: Fine-tune global stability models with auxiliary stethoscope on instability-origin task
aliases: Apply λ>0 origin stethoscope during training
nodes.description: During supervised fine-tuning, attach an auxiliary two-layer probe predicting the collapse interface and set a positive weighting (0.5-16) on its cross-entropy loss to encourage extraction of physically grounded global-instability features.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Implemented during gradient-based supervised training phase described in 'Promotion of Complementary Information'.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Evidence limited to single-paper proof-of-concept experiments on synthetic data.
nodes.node_rationale: Proposed actionable step derived from auxiliary stethoscope mechanism and its validation.

nodes.name: Fine-tune global stability models with adversarial stethoscope on local-stability task
aliases: Apply λ<0 local stethoscope during training
nodes.description: Attach a probe trained to predict local stability and back-propagate its loss with a negative weight (e.g., λ = −8) so the encoder learns representations invariant to the visual local-stability cue, reducing prediction bias.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Added during fine-tuning stage as per 'Suppression of Nuisance Information'.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Validated only in controlled experiments on simulated data; no large-scale deployment yet.
nodes.node_rationale: Actionable debiasing method supported by adversarial stethoscope evidence.

nodes.name: Audit representations with analytic stethoscope prior to deployment
nodes.description: Before deployment, attach capacity-controlled probes to successive layers without gradient feedback (λ = 0) to measure how much physically relevant or bias-related information is linearly accessible, flagging potential shortcut reliance.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Executed after training to test the model, matching pre-deployment evaluation phase.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Demonstrated experimentally but not yet a standard industry practice.
nodes.node_rationale: Suggested safety audit derived from analytic stethoscope mechanism and information-flow evidence.
